title: [BUG] Cannot import data ERROR 1406 (22001): Data too long for column 'value' at row 1

labels.name: needs author feedback
labels.description: Issue is waiting for the author to respond

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Willingness to contribute
- [X ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No 
- **OS Platform and Distribution**: Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: mlflow, version 1.0.0
- **Python version**:  Python 3.6.10
- **Exact command to reproduce**:
```sql
MySQL [db]> INSERT INTO `params` (`key`, `value`, `run_uuid`) VALUES ( 'preprocessor', 'HtmlStrip >> EmailTitleCleaner >> SuperImportantTokenizer >> DateTokenizer >> MonthTokenizer >> TimeTokenizer >> EmailTokenizer >> MoneyTokenizer >> YARNTokenizer >> SecureUrlTokenizer >> SomeDnsTokenizer >> UrlTokenizer >> TicketIdTokenizer >> IpTokenizer >> PhoneTokenizer >> NumberTokenizer >> RegexTokenizer >> RegexTokenizer >> SurplusSpacesCleaner', 'd4459fec14dd4e5a8655e69cefe9ae74' );
ERROR 1406 (22001): Data too long for column 'value' at row 1
```
### Describe the problem
I am using the following code https://gist.github.com/bnekolny/8ec96faa0d57913eea6bb7848c06b912 to import from file-based backend store to mysql database 

I found that default schema creates all string fields as [varchar(250) (latest_schema.sql#L104)](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/resources/db/latest_schema.sql#L104) while **YAML has no such restriction, or I am wrong?**
Also, I can't find any mentioning that there is such restriction (250 max characters) at https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#concepts

I can perform the schema change:
```sql 
ALTER TABLE `params` MODIFY value VARCHAR(512) NOT NULL;
```
But what will be the side effect?

### Code to reproduce issue
value field has `varchar(250)`

```sql
MySQL [db]> SHOW CREATE TABLE params\G
*************************** 1. row ***************************
       Table: params
Create Table: CREATE TABLE `params` (
  `key` varchar(250) NOT NULL,
  `value` varchar(250) NOT NULL,
  `run_uuid` varchar(32) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`key`,`run_uuid`),
  KEY `run_uuid` (`run_uuid`),
  CONSTRAINT `params_ibfk_1` FOREIGN KEY (`run_uuid`) REFERENCES `runs` (`run_uuid`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1
1 row in set (0.001 sec)
```

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [X] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [X] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for
Model Registry
- [X] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging
- [X] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
